solution_line_template: Jim runs {miles_per_day_phase1} miles a day for {days_phase1} days for a total of {miles_per_day_phase1}*{days_phase1}=<<{miles_per_day_phase1}*{days_phase1}={total_miles_phase1}>>{total_miles_phase1} miles.
The next month Jim runs {miles_per_day_phase2} miles a day for {miles_per_day_phase2}*{days_phase2}= <<{miles_per_day_phase2}*{days_phase2}={total_miles_phase2}>>{total_miles_phase2} miles.
The last month Jim runs {miles_per_day_phase3} miles a day for {miles_per_day_phase3}*{days_phase3}=<<{miles_per_day_phase3}*{days_phase3}={total_miles_phase3}>>{total_miles_phase3} a month.

All together, Jim runs {total_miles_phase1}+{total_miles_phase2}+{total_miles_phase3}= <<{total_miles_phase1}+{total_miles_phase2}+{total_miles_phase3}={total_miles_overall}>>{total_miles_overall} miles in three months.
